start.text: Greetings, traveler. You've found me, a miner from the days when Tarnowskie Góry's veins ran rich with silver and lead. Do you seek tales from beneath the earth?

options.text: Yes, tell me about your work.
What was life like in your time?
How did mining shape this town?

work.text: Our days were long and the depths unforgiving. We extracted galena, the ore of lead and silver. The shafts were damp, and water was our constant adversary. In 1788, a steam engine from England arrived and helped drain the water.

options.text: Tell me more about the steam engine.
How did this affect the town?

life.text: Life above ground was modest. Families were tightly connected to the rhythm of the mine. The Ordunek Górny granted miners rights and attracted workers from across Europe.

town.text: The mine was the heart of Tarnowskie Góry. Its wealth drew scholars, merchants, and nobles. The town prospered when the mines thrived.

steam_engine.text: Before the engine, horses powered drainage. The steam engine allowed deeper mining and reduced flooding risks.

options.text: How did it change daily work?

dangers.text: Cave ins, gas, and flooding were constant threats. Many miners never returned home.

ordunek.text: The Ordunek Górny of 1528 established mining law and protected worker rights.

immigrants.text: Miners arrived from Franconia, Bohemia, and beyond, bringing skills and traditions.

families.text: Families supported each other through hardship. Children often followed mining traditions.

visitors.text: Scholars and famous thinkers visited to study mining methods.

innovations.text: Drainage tunnels and engineering solutions helped mines operate longer and safer.

hardships.text: War, disease, and fires tested the town repeatedly.

daily_tasks.text: Less time draining water meant more time mining ore efficiently.

challenges.text: Engines required fuel, maintenance, and trained operators.

engine_fate.text: Eventually mining slowed, and the engine was retired.

safety.text: Simple supports and ventilation were used, but risk remained.

support.text: Mining guilds and neighbors supported families of injured miners.

cope.text: Faith, brotherhood, and routine helped miners endure fear.

rights.text: Rights included wages protection and legal structure for disputes.

growth.text: It attracted skilled labor and investment.

recognition.text: It is remembered as a milestone in mining law.

conflicts.text: Occasional disputes occurred, but shared work united miners.

blend.text: Languages, recipes, and traditions merged over generations.

influences.text: Architecture and surnames still reflect this diversity.

education.text: Later, technical mining education appeared in the region.

income.text: Some families farmed or crafted tools.

traditions.text: Mining festivals reinforced identity and unity.

goethe.text: Visitors studied geology and industrial engineering methods.

impacts.text: The town gained prestige and investment.

construction.text: Tunnels were hand carved with careful surveying.

functional.text: Some tunnels survive as historical heritage sites.

adoption.text: Other mining towns studied these drainage solutions.

recover.text: Community labor rebuilt homes and infrastructure.

systems.text: Guilds and churches organized relief efforts.

production.text: Yes, deeper mining expanded silver output.

downsides.text: Dependence on fuel and machinery increased costs.

adapt.text: New technical roles emerged among miners.

coal.text: Coal was transported from regional mines.

accidents.text: Mechanical failures were rare but dangerous.

inspiration.text: Steam power spread to other industries.

commemorated.text: Historical exhibits remember early mining technology.

end.text: Thank you for listening to my tales. May the spirit of Tarnowskie Góry's miners live on in your heart.
